vulnerability_findings.name: shadowing-local
vulnerability_findings.message:
Splitter.newPuppet.newPuppet (local variable @ patch_5.sol#33) shadows:
	- Splitter.newPuppet (function @ patch_5.sol#33-38)

vulnerability_findings.name: constable-states
vulnerability_findings.message:
Splitter._addy should be constant (patch_5.sol#7)
Splitter._count should be constant (patch_5.sol#9)

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Splitter.withdraw (patch_5.sol#23-27) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.message: Splitter.getPuppetCount (patch_5.sol#29-31) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in patch_5.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.4.23 (patch_5.sol#1): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: low-level-calls
vulnerability_findings.message:
Low level call in Splitter.fundPuppets (patch_5.sol#45-53):
	-require(bool)(extra[0].call.value(_share).gas(800000)()) patch_5.sol#49
	-require(bool)(extra[1].call.value(_share).gas(800000)()) patch_5.sol#50
	-require(bool)(extra[2].call.value(_share).gas(800000)()) patch_5.sol#51
	-require(bool)(extra[3].call.value(_share).gas(800000)()) patch_5.sol#52

vulnerability_findings.name: low-level-calls
vulnerability_findings.message:
Low level call in Puppet.fallback (patch_5.sol#69-73):
	-require(bool)(target[0].call.value(msg.value).gas(600000)()) patch_5.sol#71

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_id' of Splitter.setExtra (patch_5.sol#40) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_newExtra' of Splitter.setExtra (patch_5.sol#40) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: unused-state
vulnerability_findings.message:
Splitter._addy (patch_5.sol#7) is never used in Splitter
Splitter._count (patch_5.sol#9) is never used in Splitter

vulnerability_findings.name: Exception State (SWC 110)
vulnerability_findings.message:
An assertion violation was triggered.
It is possible to trigger an assertion violation. Note that Solidity assert() statements should only be used to check invariants. Review the transaction trace generated for this issue and either make sure your program logic is correct, or use require() instead of assert() if your goal is to constrain user inputs or enforce preconditions. Remember to validate inputs from both callers (for instance, via passed arguments) and callees (for instance, via return values).
Classification: SWC-110

vulnerability_findings.name: State access after external call (SWC 107)
vulnerability_findings.message:
Read of persistent state following external call
The contract account state is accessed after an external call to a fixed address. To prevent reentrancy issues, consider accessing the state only before the call, especially if the callee is untrusted. Alternatively, a reentrancy lock can be used to prevent untrusted callees from re-entering the contract in an intermediate state.
Classification: SWC-107

Classification: SWC-107

vulnerability_findings.name: Multiple Calls in a Single Transaction (SWC 113)
vulnerability_findings.message:
Multiple calls are executed in the same transaction.
This call is executed following another call within the same transaction. It is possible that the call never gets executed if a prior call fails permanently. This might be caused intentionally by a malicious callee. If possible, refactor the code such that each transaction only executes one external call or make sure that all callees can be trusted (i.e. they’re part of your own codebase).
Classification: SWC-113
